H0.text: Discussions among earth scientists about new data have been most responsible for changing the scientific view of Earth's structure, moving from the belief that Earth was solid like a marble.

H1.text: Scientific books defining the layers of Earth have been most responsible for changing the scientific view of Earthâ€™s structure, which had previously been thought to be solid like a marble.

H2.text: A lead scientist explaining the structure of Earth has been most responsible for changing the scientific view that Earth was once thought to be solid like a marble.

H3.text: A physical model of Earth showing its layers has been most responsible for changes in the scientific view of Earth's structure, which scientists once believed to be solid like a marble.

A4.text: Processing readings from many seismometers using seismic tomography, seismologists have mapped the mantle

A5.text: Harold Jeffreys was the first to claim, based on his study of earthquake waves, that below the mantle, the core of the Earth is liquid
